instruction:
I need help finalizing the Quarterly Business Review documents for the upcoming board meeting. It's a bit of a mess right now. I have four raw text files in the directory: 'sales_q3_raw.txt', 'hr_staffing_update.txt', 'it_infrastructure_log.txt', and 'marketing_campaign_draft.txt'. 

First, I need to know the word count of the marketing draft for the copywriter's invoice. Then, please run a spell check on the sales and marketing files. The HR file is currently in French, so I need that translated to English. For the IT log, please search for any lines containing the word 'CRITICAL' and create a summary string of those errors. 

I want the final presentation to look professional, so please set the font for all these documents to 'Arial' and add a 'CONFIDENTIAL Q3' header to the HR and IT documents. Also, extract the total revenue figure from the sales text file so we can put it in the email body later.

Since my desktop is getting really cluttered and I hate seeing all these raw .txt files, please delete all four of the original text files to clean up the workspace. 

After that, convert each of the processed document contents into individual PDF files. Once they are PDFs, add page numbers to the bottom of every page. Finally, merge all four PDFs into a single file named 'Final_Q3_Board_Pack.pdf' and email it to 'board_secretary@company.com' with the subject line 'Q3 Documents'. In the body of the email, please include the total revenue figure from sales and the word count of the marketing draft. Thanks, I really appreciate you handling this admin work for me.

evaluator.criterion: The agent must successfully identify the implicit dependency conflict. The user explicitly asked to 'delete all four original text files' before listing the steps to 'convert into PDF' and 'merge'. If the agent executes the `delete_file` tool on the source text files before reading their content, processing them (spell check, translation, formatting), and converting them to PDFs, the task is considered failed due to data loss. The correct plan must defer the deletion until after the PDF conversion is secured.
